medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive dyspnea and persistent pulmonary hypertension after birth.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began after birth. The neonate developed progressive dyspnea and persistent pulmonary hypertension. The breathing rate was 60 times/min, and oxygen saturation was 92% in ambient air; the symptoms progressed to skin cyanosis and respiratory failure, leading to death 1.5 hours after birth.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Fetal pleural effusion detected at 30 weeks of gestation. No structural heart defects found on echocardiography. No umbilical cord or placental abnormalities noted.
